reviews.text: Hi
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Eden from March 9-16 and had a wonderful trip. WE had booked a deluxe room (green bracelet) and had absolutely no issue with getting our room, It was ready when we arrived at about 3pm. We were pleasantly surprised with our room, it was clean, on the fourth floor of building two, facing the outside of the resort. WE had a great view of the ocean and the sunrise everyday. The beds were confortable. When we arrived we were very concerned about all the negative issues we had read on trip advisor. Please be reassured that we had no issues whatsover all week. Our rooms were cleaned daily, linen was changed and all supplies in the bar and in the bathroom were replenish daily. We had at two instance problem with our toilet and it was fixed within a few minutes. I have not seen any of the complaints I had read about. We were served promplty at the bars. The service was great. We did have to get up early to have chairs on the beach. WE were able to eat at all of the restaurant and we were able to go to the Italian and Asian ones twice. WE usually went to the restaurant at 7:30. We got a pager and within half an hour to forty minutes we were seated. The beach area is wonderful and the sand is the softest I have seen. There are guards all over the resort for your own safety. Work was being done in one area but the noise was minimal almost none. If you have a trip booked at this hotel and are like us a bit worried please stop worrying. The resort is beautiful, well kept and well managed. The people working are great and friendly. We speak french and english and had no issues being understood or understanding them. There were shows everynight from 9:45-10:45 and then the bars are open longer. By then we were too tired to stay up anyway. The room area was always quiet. There are activites all day and you can get the sheet explaining all of those on the guess service table. When we arrived we had a tour given to us by our bell boy. He brought us to our room and explained how everything worked. If you are going to this hotel and are stressing about all of the bad reviews stop stressing. We had a wonderful week, the weather was great 83 degrees every day. I cannot find anything negative to say about this hotel except that the rudeness was mostly caused by some of the guests. This is a wonderful resort.
reviews.title: Edenh Real Arena...Heaven on Earth!

likes.liked: — Service, Rooms, Food, Resort Layout, Shows, Bars, Atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at EdenH from March 6th to March 13th. Our package was Mirage at EdenH sold by Transat Holidays (aka yellow bracelets). General thoughts about this resort. EdenH is a new resort, chic, stylish, addressing to a certain type of traveler. Most of the restaurant, bar, lobby space is air conditioned. There’s no loud music anywhere. All garden rocks conceal speakers playing soft piano music during the day (that what’s commonly called elevator music; I don’t say it’s right or wrong, but this is what this resort offers). Given the fact that Punta Cana is developing at high rate, it’s time to have some new resorts different from what we’ve always seen around. They cannot make everybody happy. So, if you expect wild parties and loud club or Latino music day and night, this resort is not for you. Also if you like the open air resort style, EdenH is not for you. Also, if you travel in groups larger than a couple planning to share one room, or if you travel with kids or in-laws or friends/relatives sharing the same room this resort may not be for you. There’s no point trying to change the resort to fit your desires. The resort is what its management wants it to be. Leave it that way. There’s plenty of choice in Punta Cana to fit al needs and vacation styles. This being said I’ll go on with my review.
reviews.title: Loved the EdenH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In: Arrived at midnight. We were invited in the VIP check-in area and finished check-in in 5 minutes. The room numbers were already assigned at the time we got there. We were given the keys, beach cards, all coupons (massage, internet) and a map of the resort. We were explained where all major things are. Then the bell boy took us and our luggage to the room showing us the points of interest on our way (restaurants, the Tantra bar…).
reviews.title: Edenh gets a thumbs up

reviews.text: Room: We were in room 2221. According to previous reviews and forum postings this was supposed to be a “good” room. Building 2, odd number – means pool view. Second floor – means privacy, less mosquitoes and no need for the elevator - the ones close to our room were working fine, but did not check the rest of the building. The room was close to the pool and equally distanced from the beach and restaurants and we liked that. I’m not going to insist on the room layout, everybody knows that already: ours was a deluxe room with that well-known opening in the bathroom wall. Did look weird, but we did not have any issue with that. Notable is the fact that one year ago we’ve been in a very similar room at Majestic (jr. Suite) just that in that case there was no wall at all. Wonder why so many people complain about the setup at EdenH while everybody seems to like the same thing at Majestic (judging by the rating it’s getting). To our surprise, after all we’ve read, everything in the room was in its place and fully functional. We found the bottle of rum and the fruit basket waiting for us. The slippers and bathrobes were missing but we’ve got those the next day. The room was cleaned daily and resupplied with toiletries and drinks. Yes, there were only two beer cans daily but that’s what we’ve got at all other Dominican resorts we’ve been to. The first night we spotted four mosquitoes and put a violent end to their sad life. Next days we haven’t seen more than one on occasions. We came equipped with a Raid spray can and used it in the room every night before going to dinner/bar/show. Was efficient enough to kill any mosquito that may have sneaked in while the maid was cleaning the room. First two days the maid came to clean in the morning, while we were at the pool and we also had turn down service. After the wave of March break teenagers hit the resort on Sunday our turn down service disappeared (too bad, chocolates were nice) and the maid started to show up at 5 pm for cleaning. Did not mind and assumed these are the effects of understaffing at peak periods.
reviews.title: Beautiful but BORING!

reviews.text: Guest Services: They’ve been very nice helping us renting a car. Did not have anything else to deal with them. Other couple in our party had the air conditioner broken in their room. They complained to guest services and the air conditioner was fixed the same evening.
reviews.title: EdenH - Good and Bad

likes.disliked: — mosquitos, beach needs to be sifted for sharp objects, drinks were bad tasting

reviews.text: Food: Breakfast is served everyday at the main buffet. One may complain of monotony. Yes, there are the same things every day, but there’s variety and it’up to you to pick different food all the time. Everybody constantly reading reviews and forum posts must have heard about Felix. Well, for those who don’t know, Felix is the omlette guy. He will offer you an omlette made to order and nice, personalized conversation. But this can backfire sometimes: one day Felix was just talking with an Ottawa guy about how great the Sens were, totally ignoring the fact that the next in line (a Torontonian) strongly disagreed with that line of conversation :-) Don’t get sucked in hokey talk Felix! Just kidding, Felix is just a great guy. The lineup for his omlette is 10-20 minutes long, on the right side as you look at his station. I have a tip here: if you don’t like waiting, lineup on the left side. You’ll be served by Eduardo, the quiet one, very fast, with an equally good omlette, but without conversation. I don’t think Eduardo speaks any English, actually I’ve never heard him saying anything at all, but he understands “two over easy” for sure (I tried that). Lineup for Eduardo is usually 1-2 minutes long. About a la carte restaurants. People lineup at 5:30 for dinner and wait until 6:30 when restaurants open. I hate waiting in line and, because of this, I’ve never been in the Asian a la carte. With the other three it was easy: we showed up between 7 and 7:30 pm and were either admitted immediately or got a pager and came back in half hour with no lineup. I still think a reservation system of any sort will straighten things up. It’s a little bit annoying to leave the room to have a nice dinner in an a la carte restaurant and end up eating in the buffet. A la carte restaurants we were in were nice, service was ok. Having to put with general issues like cost, efficiency and specific ones like shortage of staff and language skills the management has a process in place: the hostess runs the pagers and takes people in, then there’s only one person (probably the most skilled in English) taking all the orders and then it’s the regular waiting staff taking care of your dinner and your glasses. Cool, every restaurant can be run with only two English speaking staffers. We all read horror stories on this forum about these restaurants, but I, personally, did not witness anything wrong. Everything was clockwork while we were in there. Like everybody else we’ve heard the rumors about this American couple that were waiting seated at a table in the Italian restaurant without being server for 1 or 2 hours. After I’ve seen those waiters at work I don’t think something like this can be possible (unless they were hidden under the table, told staff they don’t want to be disturbed or something like this). The food was good, nothing extraordinary, just the food you’d expect (and get) at any other good resort in the Punta Cana area. We only tried the house wine, both red and white. It’s ok, nothing to write home about, but a nice, decent wine, going well with food. Can’t remember getting anything better at other resorts in the area.
reviews.title: Amazing time at Edenh

likes.liked: — Beach, pools, food, service, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Lack of music/ambiance at the pools and later in the evening.

reviews.text: I'll keep this short, sweet, and to the point :0) The hotel was pretty, quiet, and peaceful. Downfall: not crazy about the "no wall" between the bathroom and bedroom..lil more privacy would be nice. Beach was beautiful!!! The activity guys were AWESOME...especially Jose and Acon.
reviews.title: FUN activity workers!!

likes.disliked: — no wall b/t bathroom and bedroom

reviews.text: The activity guys definitely made our trip. There happy, fun, free spirited personalities brought life, laughter to the day....Que CATASTROFICO!!!!! Food: Good. The hotel needs a club. EVERYONE working at the hotel was friendly, and helpful. My best friend and I had a GREAT TIME. We would definitely go back!!
reviews.title: Nice, friendly but not best accommodations

likes.disliked: — Toilet did not flush for three of the 7 days

reviews.text: The people at the resort were very nice and we were given a free upgrade upon arrival because we had a large group. Don't be afraid to ask for this. Rooms were nice, pools were great. Beach was fine but had a lot a sea weed. No snorkel from the beach at all. (nothing to see) Try the dirty monkey drink, it was very good. On a scale of 10, I would give this resort a 7. It needs more entertainment! The beach party on Friday was nice and the casino was very, very small and the people that worked there was not friendly at all. The food was average at the buffets but very good in the entree restaurants. Would recommend men to take long pants because they are required at the entree restaurants, it would be nice if the resort allowed men to wear shorts to them because the guys in our group complained about having to wear long pants everytime. Considering the temperature and the fact that the air condition was not very cool anywhere other than the rooms, they should allow shorts for men.
reviews.title: Good vacation

reviews.text: My husband, 16 year-old daughter, 8 year-old son, and I stayed at the Edenh Real from July 12 to July 19. This was our first vacation in the Dominican Republic. We felt that overall it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Punta Cana Beatiful but Resort was Just Okay !!

likes.disliked: — trouble with front desk and stolen credit card number

reviews.text: 1.The rooms were clean and spacious. However, the large open space between the bathroom and the rest of the room was an issue for our 16 year-old daughter. This was quickly fixed by the housekeeping staff by placing a sheet over the opening. The mini bar was always refilled daily.
reviews.title: a big noooo !!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed there Jan 21 for 1 week. Things started off badly with the disorganized and unacceptably slow check-in. We were fortunate to have our rooms (4 people) within 2 hours of entering the lobby as we spoke to numerous guests who waited up to 6 plus hours to receive there rooms. Also numerous reports of the same rooms being issued to multiple guests ; Spoke to two couples who had arriving guests walk into there rooms more than once. I also experienced this one afternoon as I was taking a nap and in walked an newly arrived couple who were "assigned "our room. After that we kept the deadbolt lock on when in the room. Other annoying things were the open concept bathrooms ;looks great but not practical.
reviews.title: Should have stayed elsewhere

reviews.text: Pros: Beautiful new resort, large rooms, okay to good food at the 2 buffets and the Asian restaurant, friendly and hardworking staff if undertrained.
reviews.title: What a wonderful week!

reviews.text: Hi,This is short and sweet.Don't know what types of resorts the Americans are visiting because this is an excellent resort with excellent service.I too was worried about the bad reviews but I was pleasantly surprised.To Canadians travelling there,i am sure most will have an excellent experience.I have travelled to a Sandals resort and Edenh is right up there with it as one of the best resorts I have stayed at.The dollar value of this trip was unbelieveable.My husband cannot stay in our own province for a week ski-dooing for 1200.00.Some reviews say this place will be great once the kinks are ironed out.I say what kinks?Enjoy your trip.
reviews.title: Excellent resoert!!!

likes.liked: — The newness and cleanlieness of resort!!!
likes.disliked: — Bathrooms open to room.Need to bring shower curtain.

reviews.text: My friend and I traveled to EDENH from April13-20
reviews.title: Not the best but it's not the worst either
edeNH real area - Punta Cana
reviews.text: CHECK IN

Check in was about 15 minutes because there was 2 bus loads of people that just arrived at the hotel, we were about halfway in the line. The "incence dispenser person" attacked us in line lol, we all got a bit choked up, it was interesting!
reviews.title: Five Stars All the Way!!

likes.liked: — Friendly Staff, Excellent Food, Fabulous Room!!

reviews.text: Food....Is very inportant when it comes to vacation....I would give the main buffet a poor review....The food wasnt nice at all and seen bacon 2 times on buffet in two weeks...It had no taste and i am a chef by trade in canada....
reviews.title: Just got back from a GREAT time!

likes.liked: — food was good- grounds clean, friendly service
likes.disliked: — not having consistancy in alcohol choices

reviews.text: Now the three main restaurants ..one need to reserve a seat...We use to go around six oclock and always got in right away and you can eat there as many times as you like..The food was the best i had out side my own in these restaurants..I would give them a 41/2 star....
reviews.title: A REALLY nice place- forget the bad reviews!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Staff all around and the choice in food, pools and beach
likes.disliked: — bar service indoors, drinks too strong or too sweet! , shows (but hard to find bad)

reviews.text: ..The rooms ..very very clean and new...the chamber ladies was so friendly and clean..It to was so inportant to have clean sheets and a clean room...
reviews.title: our vacation

reviews.text: Entertainment....Well if you need it on vacation...you will not find it here...very little....Now this was in april and may..Things change when the hotels read there reviews...And they always do read the reviews...so it is inportant to write them....
reviews.title: Excellent vacation at the Eden

reviews.text: Stayed at the EdenH from April 5th - 12th. Arrived early, around 9:45 to the resort. Upon arriving, upgraded to the pink bracelets because we were on vacation and wanted to drink great drinks. We expected a fruit tray, rum, etc. upon entering the room, only to find out later that you only get the full Pink Bracelet deal if you book with your travel agent. At that point it was too late, so we just enjoyed the premium liquor and got it for all our friends as well. We were shown right to our room, while some of our friends had to wait until 3 or so. No big deal.
reviews.title: Good, but could be better

likes.liked: — Clean, great food, sun and beach were divine
likes.disliked: — The sewer smell in our room, beach chair reservation system

reviews.text: The beach is amazing. White sand, quite clear considering the surf. Seaweed is raked up every morning and taken away. The chair issue was ok - we are early risers so it was no big deal. We lounged one day by the pool, and it was great too. We had no problems finding chairs by the pool. We did notice many people "towel reserving" chairs by the beach, and those chairs sat empty the ENTIRE day. They should have a ticket system - you get a ticket and place it on the chair with the towels. If you are not back in an hour, bye bye chair. That would be fair. We saw some people dumping belongings off of chairs, and saw the security guards taking towels from chairs which weren't occupied within an hour. We walked up and down both sides of the beach. Watch out for the beach vultures - they will try to drag you in to their shops. Be ready to barter if you go.
reviews.title: Great Resort - Loved It!!!

reviews.text: The food was amazing. We mostly ate at the buffet, the beach grill and tried 3 of the restaurants. The hibachi is hard to get into, so be prepared to wait in line if you really want it. The beeper system was fine for us, but we saw a lot of nasty people who were very upset at not getting seated for supper. They ended up in the buffet. The restaurants were ambient, but quite small. The food was good, fast and service was fine.
reviews.title: OK vacation

reviews.text: We and our friends did have some issues - we had a terrible sewer smell in our room for the last three days that seemed to come in through the air conditioning. They came to try to fix it, but we just ended up turning off the air conditioning. Our friends had a flood through the light fixture in their bathroom. They called maintenance and they said they would fix it tomorrow. I guess electrocution isn't high on their emergency list! The same friends also got eaten alive by something in their bed. They were on the 3rd floor with no mosquitoes, so upon returning home their dr thought it likely bedbugs. Something that should be further investigated. The rooms were cleaned well, and we never saw the cleaner or the bar restocker the entire trip. Everything was just always done when we returned.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our ground floor room had a jacuzzi on the deck, but the plug was missing. We "Borrowed" one from another jacuzzi. We enjoyed our bath with the security guard walking by. ;)
reviews.title: Was pleasantly surprised

likes.disliked: — I liked everything, I guess I'm easy to please

reviews.text: We arrived at Edenh Real Arena on Feb 29. A family of 8 in four rooms. We checked in immediately on arrival at 2:30 pm and went directly to our rooms, no bellman, just directed to stay to the left. We were given an envelope with our room cards, towel cards and a letter describing the amenities of the resort and restaurants hours of operations.
reviews.title: A Great Time at Edenh Real Arena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had green wristbands but stayed in Paradise Club rooms which were in order and clean. The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms. The mattresses are really firm. If your TV is in Spanish only check the menu and change the language to English. The room was cleaned and towels replaced every morning and our toiletries were replaced when used up. Every evening fresh towels were brought in during the turn down service. We tipped a dollar in the am and another in the pm and left a dollar in the fridge each day for the mini-bar re-stocker.
reviews.title: WELL on it's way!!!

likes.liked: — The room, the beach, the entire grounds! And don't forget the entertainment staff!!!
likes.disliked: — A la carte reservation system, lack of staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good with lots of choice and great coffee. Only once did we have trouble finding a table and waited a couple of minutes until it was cleared and reset.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great place to go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful and we stayed everyday from 10 until 4. The lounge chairs were secured by waking up before six and tying towels to the backs. I never reserved 8 as we were never all together at one time on the beach but usually had 6, The shortage of chairs is really a problem and I didn't see people reserving at beach and pool as we saw the same people near us each day and they stayed most of the day. I also rarely saw unoccupied chairs for hours. The day after we arrived white plastic chairs arrived on the beach but did not help much to provide the necessary seating.
reviews.title: Loved Edenh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate lunch everyday at the beach grill. The food was ok but repetitive. We could have walked up to the buffet if we had wanted more variety. The al a carte restaurants for dinner were great, the Asian excellent. We waited in line for reservations each day some days for 10 minutes others for 45, not much longer than many restaurants in Toronto on Friday evening.
reviews.title: We had a great time!
fantastic time at EdenH
reviews.text: We were at EdenH from 14-28 August - it was our first visit to DR and we had a fantastic time.

reviews.title: Loved the Edenh
reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy, and bags were taken to our room, which as ready when we arrived, and very clean and spacious. We were on 4th floor at the Plaza end of the complex, overlooking an arera of natural vegetation - it was very quiet and provided an interesting view when Tropical Storm Fay paid a visit on our first day there!!

reviews.title: Beach and Resort Beautiful, Basic Service- Not so much
reviews.text: We loved the bathroom with the open wall and the spa bath, and our maid left us clean towels whenever we wanted - the hotel follows the standard practice of replacing towels when they are left in the bath. Air conditioning was excellent as you could adjust both temperature and fan speed.

reviews.title: Edenh Real was great! Great for weddings!
reviews.text: No problem at all with mosquitoes (in fact the only one we saw was on the coach transfer to the airport!) - the fogger goes past at about 6.30 every evening and seemed to do the trick.

reviews.title: Nice, clean spot for a relaxed vacation
reviews.text: Food was plentiful and varied, and we never got tired of it, there always seemed to be something new to try. Thanks to Felix for the omelettes, and to Gabriel for his friendly welcome every morning and excellent coffee service. We booked all the a la cartes - easy if you book ahead and not try to book them on the day - if you go to book in the middle of the day there is no need to queue, and you can book as many evenings as you want. Our favourites were the Asian (you need to book both the Hibachi and the a la carte table service, they are quite different) and Senses Gourmet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vacationed at hotel from Feb. 22-29, 2008. We had no problem with reservations desk, although others had commented about long waits. Our 1st floor room was ready and fully equipped. A major problem, however, was the mosquitoes. We killed them for a few days and after complaining the room was treated promptly. Unfortunately, treatment did not help. The problem is two-fold, the 1st floor with its ground plants and the maids leaving their carts in the hallway with the door open. We endured this for too long and finally complained to our Apple rep. She was great and immediately walked us over to reservations and secured us a room on the 3rd floor. A bellhop came promptly to move our bags. Moving higher solved the mosquito problem even though the maids continued to leave the door open when cleaning. Another negative is the food which was fine, not great. The specialty restaurants are too small to accommodate most guests and they need to become much more efficient since often we waited 1-2 hours even though many tables were empty but not cleared. Food at buffet was very good and plentiful. Last and perhaps biggest negative was insufficient number of beach chairs. Getting up at 5:30-6:00 am on vacation to find 2 beach chairs and twice not finding any was annoying. Every day chairs at the pool would be dragged down to the beach. I was told more chairs would be arriving but that did not do us any good.
reviews.title: Teacher Sub Loved the Beautiful Beach

likes.liked: — large complex, beautiful beach and excellent service
likes.disliked: — insufficient beach chairs and specialty restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the positives. The standard room was spacious and always clean. The room jacuzzi worked and was a nice touch. The balcony view was lovely and the complex itself is very beautiful and large. The beach is magnificent with large palm trees and small huts for shade throughout the beach. The water was clear and any sea weed was raked on the beach. The nightly entertainment was good and varied while the drinks were plentiful and easily available whether on the beach, in a bar or at dinner. The service was excellent and the servers could not do enough to make you welcomed and comfortable. That goes for the maids, bellhops, waiters, bar maids, front desk etc...The Apple reps at the airports, hotel, on tour were extremely helpful and always willing to make our stay very pleasant.
reviews.title: I loved it!

reviews.text: It's not a 5-star hotel yet but should be in a year or two at which time it's price will double. We feel that, overall, we got a good bargain even though some kinks need to be worked out.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, very friendly people, loved it!!

likes.disliked: — Better reservation system needed for speciality restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself, my husband and another couple stayed at Edenh 2/28-3/3. I was extremely nervous about our choice of resort after reading the reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised. While the resort does have the small 'finishing touches' to add, we had an AWESOME time. It will be 5* once the small kinks are worked out. And the kinks are not of the sort to ruin a vacation, unless you are supremely picky.
reviews.title: Loved the Weather, Hotel, Not So Much
Awesome beach
reviews.text: Our checkin was for the most part smooth- we went to the checkin desk and were ushered into the VIP room (we had upgraded to Paradise Club) and found a nice lounge with snacks, a tv and top shelf liquor- we were greeted with a hearty "Welcome Home!". We didn't have to wait at all- the only negative I will say is the gentlemen checking us in appeared to have a problem finding us rooms- and seemed to be checking the computer and conferring in spanish quite a bit-and after reading the reviews about getting bumped we started getting nervous. But all was well and we received our rooms after about 20 min. My friends were on the 3rd floor in building 2, and we were on the 1st floor (rm 2176). We wanted rooms side by side or at least on the same floor, but with the resort booked to capacity we didn't really expect to get it. They did offer us a deluxe room on a closer floor, but it didn't seem worth the effort to switch -and actually our room was close to the pool so it was very convenient. It did overlook a construction fence, but not a big deal-we usually keep the curtains closed in our room anyway for privacy! No major mosquito issue, even on the 1st foor. We never used the mosquito coil we brought, and they sprayed every day. The room was nice, with the extra toiletries (bath gel, bath salts, etc in addition to shampoo, conditioner). There was an iron/board; hair dryer, coffee maker with EXCELLENT coffee, and mini-fridge with pepsi, water, beer, sprite etc.

This hotel was absolutely great, the entire trip was a dream! I went down for my friend's bachelorrette party and we had an amazing time! The hotel was clean, comfortable, and relaxing. The staff was extremely willing to help and was by your side for your every need. I will be honest, after reading the nasty reviews I was extremely nervous to go on this vacation. After arriving, however, I understood completely who was complaining. When going to the restaurants, AMERICANS were complaining about their reservations (there were no reservations allowed at the restaurants) and this one lady was SCREAMING at the hostesses demanding to know why there was not champagne on her table when she arrived. I was honestly embarrassed to be from the same country as her. There were multiple incidents with people complaining over the most ridiculous things!
reviews.title: Absolutely, positively wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I had a wonderful time. The beach and pools were beautiful and the nightly entertainment was great as well. The food was yummy too!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to go on vacation if: you have children, are honeymooning, or are an older adult looking for a great time away. I wouldn't recommend this resort for some young kids looking to get wasted and not remember the vacation. My friends and I are 22-26 and we drink but not to get wasted. It was positively the best experience. If you book through apple vacations, seek out Santos- the hotel rep. We did the marinarium excursion which was amazing- we swam with sharks and stingrays and what I like to call "dori fish" (finding nemo the movie) Hope this helps anyone who was as nervous as me!!
reviews.title: Nice trip

reviews.text: I just returned from a two week vacation at the Edenh Real Area, and I couldn't be happier. I have been staying at resorts in the Dominican Republic every summer for 12 years, and I can truly say that this resort is first-rate.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation!!!!!!

reviews.text: I loved the room. Everything was clean and new, and housekeeping did a great job. The bed was very comfortable, the plasma tv was very nice and had almost all American cable channels. I also loved the open setup of the room - you can watch tv while taking a bath! Our room was on the 4th floor, so mosquitos were not a big problem. In the evenings, I always sprayed on repellent and did not get bitten much.
reviews.title: Too Relaxing - Did not make me feel special - BORING

reviews.text: I went with my mom, sister and two friends.
reviews.title: Not Great

reviews.text: Hotel was built on a swamp and that is why there are a lot of mosquitoes. Don't stay in bulding 2 unless you face the pool because there are a lot of misquitoes. Bulding 1 is where my friends stayed had no problems with mosquitoes.
reviews.title: Relax ! A great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jewelry - Be certain to lock all your goodies in the safe. I didn't and my wedding band was missing. My own fault.
reviews.title: Three Little Birds

reviews.text: Pool - okay.
reviews.title: Don't know what all the fuss is about

reviews.text: I just stayed at Edenh Real Arena Punta Cana I booked it here knowing the resort was new and that there would be some bumps, I am not a complainer but ever since I got there that is all I found myself doing. Here is the story:
reviews.title: Not Ready To Be Open & Do Not Use Apple

likes.liked: — Beach a lot of tiki huts for shade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at EdenH Real Arena May 16-23, 2008. I will start out by saying this was our 5th trip to the Dominican always staying Punta Cana and each time we have stayed at a different resort. In our opinion EdenH was top notch and we can not wait to return.
reviews.title: Loved EdenH, Can't wait to return

reviews.text: Check-in went smooth; we were checked in right away. We did notice that the resort seemed empty, staff and guests. (We later found out the reason for the short staff was it was Election Day in the Dominican Republic so the resort tries to allow as many people to go home to vote as possible.) In our opinion it never affected our stay but did explain why there was less staff on hand then expected. We were given our room assignments and were told we were in the Paradise Club (we didn’t pay for this service, so I guess we were upgraded because they had the space available) we received our door cards and were whisked away to our rooms. Once we got to our rooms we found the maid service still cleaning one of the rooms we were assigned. No biggy, since we had two rooms, we just put our bags in the room that was clean and decided to grab lunch. We did notice that there was a little mold on the lamp shade and there was a slight mildew smell. (No big deal, we were in the Caribbean, there is water and humidity, it happens.) We thought since I am very allergic to mildew we’d go to the front and see if we could switch rooms. So after we enjoyed a good meal next to the pool we decided to go back up front. We asked if we could switch and right away they said there were no rooms available. I was guessing this really wasn’t the case especially since we were moved to the Paradise Club. What I think they meant was there weren’t anymore rooms in the Paradise Club that were clean and ready. We ended up asking for Mike to see if he could do anything about our placement or we would have made a quick call to our Travel Agent, as usually they can help in that situation. Lucky for us Mike was back and had already noticed we had checked in and he was coming to find us to see how things were going. (Again, I think Mike had a little more time because the resort wasn’t full of guests.) He ended up taking us up to 2 new rooms, which were on the fourth floor and overlooked the pool and beach. Yes, the rooms had a big opening from the bathroom to the bedroom but we were used to this, every resort we have been to in the past has had this although others have some sort of shade or hinged door if you’d like to keep the rooms separate. The one thing we all joked about was they have this beautiful heavy dark wood door leading to the bathroom with a lock on the door but a huge opening on the other side of the two person tub. What was the point of the lock? The toilet area is separated with a frosted glass and so is the shower, so unless you go on vacation with a total stranger this really shouldn’t effect your stay. The bathrooms in the Paradise Club are completely closed in and set up a little different, that is because the two person tub is outside on the balcony. Personally I’d rather have the tub inside my room. The new rooms were perfect! We knew right away this was going to be a great vacation.
reviews.title: Not even close to 5 stars...

reviews.text: The beach is beautiful. Yes, there is seaweed but the resort does everything to keep the beach clean during the day. There is a constant breeze which later we found out the resort is nestled in a cove which allows the constant airflow. We loved it. Since we were already familiar with this stretch of beach we knew there were vendors to the right and left of the resort. We love to barter, it isn’t always easy and it isn’t for everyone. We always come home with a suitcase full of Dominican goodies. So again we were happy with our choice in resorts.
reviews.title: Excellent time at Edenh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night we decided to eat at the Asian restaurant, there was no wait for a table, so three of us walked right in and sat down (the fourth was tired from the day of travel, leaving her children for the first time and just a lot of sun). The food was wonderful and the staff was very polite and very attentive. The rest of the week Clara, head concierge of the Paradise Club made reservations for us for dinner. (Again I think this had to do with the fact the resort wasn’t very crowded) We never had to wait and we felt we were treated like royalty.
reviews.title: Hotel is really suck service and smell bad in the room!!!
Honest Review!!!
reviews.text: Before we arrived we had found out that Felix (the omelet guy) had moved over to EdenH, we were super excited to hear this. The four of us walked up to the omelet station, my husband and I weren’t even standing next to each other, I said hello and right away he remembered us from last year. It was great. What a simple pleasure! Also when we were seated we noticed our same coffee guy Gabrielle from the last resort was there too. Every morning we requested his section and as soon as he saw the four of us he came right over to us coffee in hand and a nice big smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Edenh 2/22-2/27 and were so sad to leave. We were "green bands." We found that a pleasant attitude went a long way at this place, and we have fond, fond memories of our trip!
reviews.title: We will be back, too!
Have Not Arrived and it is tripling in cost
reviews.text: Rooms: Checked in within 2 minutes of arrival at hotel (greeted with welcome mimosa). When we arrived to our room, my husband and I found two double beds (it was just us). Later that day, we asked our travel rep onsite if we could be switched to a king. They didn't have a king that night, so we went back the following morning and were very pleasantly handled by desk employee and were given 2160, a fabulous room w/ king bed (also driven on a golf cart to our new room by a friendly worker who helped us with our bags). We found the bed very comfy and had no issues of smell or any lack of service with room (maid and fridge guy were wonderful). Had a couple of mosquitoes in our room on a few days, but I packed my Deet and never really had a problem. Mosquitoes are a PC problem, not a resort problem. Never saw a mosquito outside our room.

Food: Buffet was always good, especially breakfast. Always found something we liked...breakfast, lunch or dinner. (The outdoor snack bar was a little too "fried" for us, but we loved getting ice cream there.) Felix, the omelette guy in the main buffet, remembered our names and where we were from even though we hadn't seen him for over 4 days. We do suggest that the resort adds an additional 2-3 employees for each area of the buffet room so that they can divide up the labor a little bit. (It's hard to keep tabs on who just sat down when you're doing everything.) We were always serviced with drinks within a minute or two of sitting, however, and always with a smile. The staff work incredibly hard and we'd see them morning, noon and night. Also ate at the Asian and Italian restaurants -- again, attitude is key. We never participated in the 6pm line-up. We'd meander down at about 7:00 or so, and sometimes we were told we'd have to come back at 9. No biggie for us--time to chill, get a drink, and people watch in the plaza, lobby or lobby bar. The reservation issue (we discovered) is also compounded by folks putting their name in on multiple restaurants. A couple who got into the Asian restaurant with us quickly left when they were paged by the French. So apparently, hogging doesn't just apply to the chairs! Enjoyed the ala cartes. Were there late and were never asked to leave. Made friends with some couples while at the hibachi grill--a fun time..
reviews.title: Opened way too early

reviews.text: Beach/pool: The beach was too gorgeous for us to ever want to use the pool (except when we swam up to get a drink from hysterical Alexis). We "beached" it every day. Played the chair game a couple of mornings, but if not, we'd throw a towel on the sand (which by the way, we never saw a piece of glass in). Chair game is also compounded by guests. If you're told 7am, people will go at 6:30. Got earlier as the week went on. Looking forward to when they'll have some more chairs, but this was really a non-issue for us. Who goes to a beach and refuses to throw a towel on the sand? Not us, in fact, I felt lucky to be so close to sand that had the texture of powdered sugar! Also enjoyed daily walks on the beach in either direction, where you really realize Edenh's is the cleanest and nicest!
reviews.title: Way far to be a 5 stars

likes.liked: — The Lobster dinner in the room
likes.disliked: — The organisation and ARROGENCE OF THE MANAGEMENT

reviews.text: Entertainment: Enjoyed White Night and Cirque du Soleil-type night. The singers were less our style, so we didn't linger for them. We were always given a chair by the staff to see the performances, & sometimes we'd venture up to the Tanhtra bar afterwards to relax on their comfy beds, enjoy the mellow music and a drink. There was also a musician in the lobby bar. All-in-all, we were not disappointed and didn't personally need a club atmosphere late at night. Also LOVED the animation team. (Watch Kelvin dance--he's hilarious) Did some beach step aerobics after several days of eating and was glad I did. Also took a morning catamaran lesson and were allowed afterwards to use them for 30 min at a time. Was fun to get out in the water, and our instructor was great.

description: Step into the breathtaking Now Larimar Punta Cana and enjoy a wristband-free, excitement-filled getaway. Far from life’s demands. Back to its simple pleasures. Where sophistication meets understated. And the kids have as much fun as the grown-ups. Located on over 700 yards of picturesque palm-studded white sand beach on the majestic turquoise Caribbean Sea in Playa Bávaro, Now Larimar offers all of the privileges of an Unlimited-Luxury® escape in an exquisite seaside setting. Savor every moment with deluxe accommodations, reservation-free gourmet restaurants, premium cocktails, pampering in our world-class Spa, endless daytime and nighttime activities and much much more.
